Posts.Content: There are many nonlinear effects in the human body. You can't say if something has a few percent effect at low dosage on the immune system it just takes longer to see the harm. If it is a minor effect then the consequences can also be minor and most likely are. Otherwise you would see widespread cancers in cannabis users, which isn't apparent.
Posts.Title: Immunosupressive properties of cannabis.

Posts.Content: Here is a criticism of using the word 'cure' to describe #MuTaTo https://twitter.com/cispt2/status/1090453596930478080
Posts.Title: New cancer breakthroughs

Posts.Content: Thanks for those important comments about dosing. I do have a question about ""10 mg/kg body weight" is ~75x typical humane dose." If a person weighs 50 kg then 10 mg/kg = 0.5 gram which is about 1 joint (roughly). How do you get 75x typical human dose?
Posts.Title: Immunosupressive properties of cannabis.

Posts.Content: I think the issue of interrupting sleep for people who have to stay overnight in hospital is under appreciated. I agree with this nytimes article: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/03/upshot/why-hospitals-should-l... In addition, in Canada I have experienced very long waits at emergency to be seen and then to get a hospital bed.
Posts.Title: How should we improve hospitals?
